ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I became a much stronger writer.
I learned how to express my ideas extremely well, and how to unclutter my sentences from my thoughts.

I was really unsure and struggling with papers before I started this class, but by the end of it I feel so much more confident in my writing and will carry it into the next courses I take. Ben provided a lot of feedback on rough drafts and offered many opportunities to meet during office hours to discuss how to improve the structure and arguments of my paper.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Some readings were a little tough. Restructuring the syllabus could help.

I really enjoyed the content of this course and how broad of a scope we had when looking at the different aspects of museums. I think the most important thing is to have an interest in the subject and the readings will be more engaging for you.
The one downside I had was that the majority of students in the already small class weren't as enthused about the subject as the remaining were and made it rough when nobody was willing to participate. But even then, the few that actually did the readings and enjoyed the subject managed to make the discussions very engaging.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it is a great class even if you are not interested in museums.
I would recommend this class to those who want to improve their writing and who also have an interest in anything related to humanities, cultural studies, and art in addition to museums.
